vision.notes: Likely important for foraging in coral reefs and identifying conspecifics. Found in tropical and subtropical waters in the Atlantic, Pacific and Indian Oceans.

chemoreception.notes: Inferred to be present as a standard sense for fish, used for detecting food and potentially conspecifics in aquatic environments.

mechanoreception.notes: Lateral line system inferred to be present, allowing detection of water movement and pressure changes, important for predator avoidance and prey detection. General sense common to fish.
